items.title: Verizon just got permission to keep your phone locked for longer
items.summary: The FCC just scrapped its age-old 60-day unlocking rule for Verizon.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR The FCC has officially scrapped its 60-day phone unlocking requirements for Verizon. Verizon can now lock phones for longer periods of time for both prepaid and postpaid customers. While the new rules make it harder to switch carriers, theyâ€™re being implemented to help curb stealing and fraudulently buying Verizon phones. The FCC has officially ended Verizonâ€™s long-standing 60-day policy for phone unlocking. The carrier is now allowed to keep phones locked to its network for longer periods of time.

It’s official, TWICE is going on tour this year, making multiple stops in the United States. The JYP Entertainment girl group is a hit among K-Pop and non-K-Pop fans alike, bringing playful and toe-tapping tunes accompanied by polished dancing and powerful live vocals. Even on the Billboard charts, TWICE is constantly winning with tracks like “This Is For,” “The Feels” and “Moonlight Sunrise,” all English tracks that don’t even begin to scratch the surface of their many Japanese and Korean language hits. The girl group’s last major tour was the Ready To Be World Tour, which began all the way back in 2023, so needless to say, fans are hungry to see the members in person on their 2026 tour . The group’s first stop on the tour will be on Jan. 13 in Seattle at the Climate Pledge Arena. items.title: NASA, SpaceX Invite Media to Watch Crew-12 Launch to Space Station
items.summary: Media accreditation is open for the launch of NASAâ€™s 12th rotational mission of a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket and Dragon spacecraft carrying astronauts to the International Space Station for a science expedition from Space Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. NASA announceâ€¦
items.body: From left to right, NASA astronauts Jessica Meir and Jack Hathaway, ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev. NASA Media accreditation is open for the launch of NASAâ€™s 12th rotational mission of a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket and Dragon spacecraft carrying astronauts to the International Space Station for a science expedition from Space Launch Complex 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station in Florida. NASA announced it is targeting no earlier than Thursday, Jan. 15, for a splashdown of its Crew-11 mission. The agency also is working with SpaceX and international partners to advance the launch of Crew-12, which is currently slated for Sunday, Feb. 15. The crew includes NASA astronauts Jessica Meir , commander, Jack Hathaway , pilot; ESA (European Space Agency) astronaut Sophie Adenot, mission specialist; and Roscosmos cosmonaut Andrey Fedyaev, mission specialist. This will be the second spaceflight for Meir and Fedyaev, and the first for Hathaway and Adenot to the orbiting laboratory. Media accreditation deadlines for the Crew-12 launch as part of NASAâ€™s Commercial Crew Program are as follows: International media without U.S. citizenshâ€¦

The reunion tour was announced in Aug. of 2024, two days before the 30th anniversary of the band’s debut album Definitely Maybe . The show ran from July 4, 2025, at the Principality Stadium in Cardiff, Wales, to Nov. 23rd at Estádio do Morumbi in São Paulo, Brazil. To really hammer home the scale, the tour grossed $405,428,435 and was attended by over two million people, making it the second highest-grossing and third most attended tour of 2025. Not all hope is lost, though, since a lot seems to be lined up for the English rock band in 2026. items.title: A Quarter Century in Orbit: Science Shaping Life on Earth and Beyond
items.summary: For more than 25 years, humans have lived and worked continuously aboard the International Space Station, conducting research that is transforming life on Earth and shaping the future of exploration. From growing food and sequencing DNA to studying disease and simulating Mars missions, every experiâ€¦
items.body: For more than 25 years, humans have lived and worked continuously aboard the International Space Station, conducting research that is transforming life on Earth and shaping the future of exploration. From growing food and sequencing DNA to studying disease and simulating Mars missions, every experiment aboard the orbiting laboratory expands our understanding of how humans can thrive beyond Earth while advancing science and technology that benefit people around the world. Unlocking new cancer therapies from space NASA astronaut Christina Koch works on MicroQuin’s protein crystallization research aboard the International Space Station. NASA The space station gives scientists a laboratory unlike any on Earth. In microgravity, cells grow in three dimensions, proteins form higher-quality crystals, and biological systems reveal details hidden by gravity. These conditions open new ways to study disease and develop treatments .  Astronauts and researchers have used the orbiting laboratory to observe how cancer cells grow, test drug delivery methods, and examine protein structures linked to diseases such as Parkinsonâ€™s and Alzheimerâ€™s. One example is the Angiex Cancer Therapy stâ€¦

items.title: Maverick City Music Countersues Co-Founder for $10M Over Competing WorshipÂ Choir
items.summary: The Grammy-winning group is locked in a legal battle with founding executive Tony Brown.
items.body: Maverick City Music is firing back in a legal battle over co-founder Tony Brown â€™s exit from the Grammy-winning worship collective, accusing the executive of violating his non-compete by launching a new Christian music project. Brown has been suing Maverick City in Georgia court since 2024 for allegedly strong-arming him into signing an unfavorable buyout agreement. The Atlanta-based group denies any wrongdoing, and on Dec. 8, they filed a countersuit in New York, accusing Brown of breaching the terms of that contract. items.title: Verizon and AT&T argue the FCCâ€™s fines are unconstitutional as is, Supreme Court will step in
items.summary: The Supreme Court is expected to have a decision by the summer.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Previously, the Federal Communications Commission fined AT&T (~$57M) and Verizon (~$47M) for failing to protect customer location data, leading both sides to demand a review, asserting the fines violated their right to a jury trial. While the US Court of Appeals for the 5th Circuit ruled in favor of AT&T, the 2nd Circuit ruled in favor of the government over Verizon. The Supreme Court is now being asked to step in and make a final ruling that will apply to both, though the decision wonâ€™t likely arrive until the summer of 2026. After it determined Verizon and AT&T had willfully violated the law by failing to protect customer location data, the FCC previously ordered AT&T and Verizon to pay roughly $57 million and $47 million, respectively. While both companies paid the fines as expected, they also opted to sue over the matter independently. Now the Supreme Court is getting involved as well, as reported by The Hill . items.title: Google Nest Wi-Fi Pro plummets to new record-low price!
items.summary: Save half off the Google Nest Wi-Fi Pro!
items.body: Credit: Kris Carlon / Android Authority Is your current router just not fast enough? Perhaps it needs a wider reach, or you need to connect more devices. Whatever the case, hereâ€™s a deal that will make it affordable to upgrade to a premium Wi-Fi experience. The Google Nest Wi-Fi Pro is currently available at a new record-low price, a price weâ€™ve never seen before. Buy the Google Nest Wi-Fi Pro for just $99.99 ($100 off)

items.title: Koepka to make PGA return in January under new scheme
items.summary: Five-time major champion Brooks Koepka will make his comeback on the PGA Tour in January under a new returning member programme, following his departure from LIV Golf.

items.title: Cascarino denied WSL debut because of earring
items.summary: West Ham's new signing Estelle Cascarino was denied a chance to make her Women's Super League debut because of an earring.

items.title: January 2026â€™s Pixel update is here to fix noisy ringback tones and battery drain issues
items.summary: January's update is here to squash bugs and make improvements.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google has rolled out the January update for supported Pixel devices running Android 16. The update includes bug fixes and improvements, like a fix for battery drain under certain conditions. This is an update for the Pixel 7a and newer devices. Weâ€™re 12 days into the new year and it looks like Google is ready to release the first Pixel update of 2026. Januaryâ€™s security patch is rolling out to supported Pixel devices running Android 16 . It looks like the patch will be skipping over the Pixel 6 series and 7 series, but it will be available to the Pixel 7a, Pixel 8 series, Pixel 8a, Pixel 9 series, Pixel 9a, Pixel 10 series, Pixel Tablet, and Pixel Fold. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Google Home adds smarter routines for TVs, appliances, and security systems
items.summary: More automation triggers and actions aim to make Google Home routines feel less limited.
items.body: Credit: Brady Snyder / Android Authority TL;DR Google Home is rolling out new automation triggers and actions focused on routines and device control. You can now automate tasks such as media playback, appliance control, security systems, blinds, and robot vacuums. More automation features are planned, with another batch expected in the coming weeks. Google is rolling out a fresh batch of automation tools for the Google Home app, expanding what you can control across connected devices. The update focuses squarely on routines, adding new starters, conditions, and actions that give you more granular control over your smart home . The changes were highlighted in a post on X by Google Home Chief Product Officer Anish Kattukaran, who stated that the update introduces approximately 20 new automation elements. Examples include dimming the lights when a TV starts playing, announcing when a washer finishes a cycle, or automatically arming a security system at a set time. According to Kattukaran, more automation â€œtraitsâ€ are already in the pipeline, with another batch expected in the coming weeks.

items.title: Is Carrick the right man for Man Utd?
items.summary: Michael Carrick is favourite to be named Man United's next interim manager. Simon Stone assesses if he is the right fit for the job.

items.title: Macclesfield to host Brentford in FA Cup fourth round - see full draw
items.summary: Sixth-tier Macclesfield are rewarded with a home tie against Brentford in the FA Cup fourth round after their shock win over holders Crystal Palace.

items.title: 2026 Civil Space Shortfall Ranking
items.summary: NASA has identified a list of 32 technology shortfalls and invites you to give input on your critical technology needs using this feedback mechanism. Whether youâ€™re part of the space technology community or an interested member of the public, your input is invaluable. By registering and providing yâ€¦
items.body: NASA NASA has identified a list of 32 technology shortfalls and invites you to give input on your critical technology needs using this feedback mechanism. Whether youâ€™re part of the space technology community or an interested member of the public, your input is invaluable. By registering and providing your feedback, you could help inform of national space technology priorities. NASA will analyze and aggregate the rankings to produce priority lists for each stakeholder group, which will be made publicly available for continued collaboration. This prioritization framework will guide the Space Technology Mission Directorateâ€™s evaluation of current development efforts to identify necessary adjustments within its existing portfolios. The shortfall prioritization process may inspire new investments or spark innovative partnerships with stakeholders. This initiative also has the potential to unlock emerging commercial opportunities and accelerate growth in the U.S. space economy. Understanding and prioritizing the most important and impactful efforts allows STMD to appropriately direct available resources to best support mission needs for NASA and the nation. Open Date: January 12, 2026 â€¦

items.title: NASA Welcomes Portugal as 60th Artemis Accords Signatory
items.summary: Portugal is the latest nation to sign the Artemis Accords alongside 59 other countries in a commitment to advancing principles for the responsible exploration of the Moon, Mars, and beyond with NASA. â€œPortugal joins a cadre of nations building the framework for safe, transparent, and prosperous actâ€¦
items.body: Hugo Costa, executive director for the Portuguese Space Agency, and U.S. Ambassador to Portugal John J. Arrigo pose for a photo on Jan. 12 during a ceremony in Lisbon, Portugal, to mark the country’s signing of the Artemis Accords. Credit: U.S. State Department Portugal is the latest nation to sign the Artemis Accords alongside 59 other countries in a commitment to advancing principles for the responsible exploration of the Moon, Mars, and beyond with NASA. â€œPortugal joins a cadre of nations building the framework for safe, transparent, and prosperous activity in space,â€ said NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman in recorded remarks. â€œThis is our generationâ€™s Golden Age of Exploration. Together, we are advancing innovation, driving international collaboration, and discovering the secrets of the universe.â€ Portugalâ€™s Secretary of State for Science and Innovation Helena CanhÃ£o signed the Artemis Accords on behalf of the country on Jan. 11.  â€œ2026 is the year in which humans will return to the Moon. It will mark the beginning of a new era of space exploration, reminiscent of the Portuguese explorers of the past, such as Magellan and his circumnavigation of our planet,â€ said Huâ€¦

items.title: Apple confirms: Gemini will power a new and improved Siri this year
items.summary: The companies call it 'a multi-year collaboration.'
items.body: TL;DR Apple and Google have jointly announced that Apple Intelligence features and Siri will incorporate Gemini models. The partnership was first reported in November, but has only now been officially confirmed. A Gemini-powered Siri could debut in iOS 26.4 this spring. Apple is partnering with Google to incorporate Gemini into Siri and Apple Intelligence. The two companies have announced a multi-year deal thatâ€™ll see Apple build on Googleâ€™s AI models to power AI features on iPhone, iPad, and Mac, including with â€œa more personalized Siriâ€ arriving this year. â€œApple determined that Googleâ€™s Al technology provides the most capable foundation for Apple Foundation Models,â€ a joint statement published on Google â€˜s Keyword blog says.

items.title: Amazon is forcibly upgrading Prime members to Alexa Plus, and users are not happy
items.summary: A new Amazon Prime perk has Alexa users up in arms.
items.body: Credit: Stephen Schenck / Android Authority TL;DR Alexa users who are Amazon Prime members are reportedly being automatically upgraded to Alexa Plus. Users who have been upgraded can revert to the old Alexa by saying, â€œAlexa, exit Alexa Plus.â€ One user claims that they were â€œflooded with adsâ€ after downgrading back to Alexa. Amazon recently announced the launch of a dedicated website for Alexa Plus , allowing you to access the upgraded AI assistant directly from your browser. NASA/Danny Nowlin Richard Wear calls it an honor to be working at NASAâ€™s Stennis Space Center near Bay St. Louis, Mississippi, during a historic time as NASA prepares to send astronauts around the Moon for the first time in more than 50 years on the Artemis II mission. â€œI have not stopped learning in the 15 years that I have been here,â€ Wear said. As acting chief of the Mechanical Engineering Branch, the Slidell, Louisiana, resident primarily supports testing at the E Test Complex, where NASA and commercial companies carry out propulsion test operations. The complex features four stands with 12 test cells capable of supporting a range of component and engine test activities. The versatility of the complex infrastructure and test team allows it to support projects for commercial aerospace companies, large and small. â€œThe unique high pressure systems bring customers from all over the country,â€ Wear said. â€œI am proud to have been a part of testing for our commercial partners over the years, some of which have become successfâ€¦

items.title: Complement-ARIE NAMs Reduction to Practice Challenge
items.summary: Recent technological advances have set the stage for a renewed focus on human-based solutions called new approach methodologies (NAMs) that can complement, and in some cases replace, animal models in research and regulatory testing. These NAMs generally span advanced cell-tissue-organoid (in vitro)â€¦
items.body: Recent technological advances have set the stage for a renewed focus on human-based solutions called new approach methodologies (NAMs) that can complement, and in some cases replace, animal models in research and regulatory testing. These NAMs generally span advanced cell-tissue-organoid ( in vitro ), computational modeling ( in silico ), and cell-free biochemical analysis ( in chemico ) techniques, with each type of NAM offering different advantages. A combination and integration of multiple NAMs elements into a synergistic approach that augments gaps and/or deficiencies in individual NAMs approaches is a â€œcombinatorial NAMâ€ and could ultimately allow for improved predictions of human clinical response. Although many combinatorial NAMs are still early in development, not validated and standardized, nor available to the market broadly, combinatorial NAMs can potentially transform the way biomedical research, drug development, and clinical trials are conducted. To accelerate development and validation of combinatorial NAMs for human-based scientific and regulatory purposes, the National Institutes of Health (NIH) Common Fundâ€™s Complement-Animal Research In Experimentationâ€¦

items.title: Apple beat Samsung to be the top phone seller in the world, and hereâ€™s why
items.summary: It wasn't a bad year for Samsung, but there are various reasons that it was a better one for its biggest rival.
items.body: TL;DR Apple finished 2025 as the worldâ€™s top smartphone brand in terms of units shipped, extending its lead over Samsung thanks to faster year-on-year growth. Appleâ€™s advantage stemmed from premium demand, a delayed upgrade cycle, and strong sales across multiple iPhone generations. Google and Nothing both posted strong growth, but 2026 could be tougher as rising component costs hit the broader Android market. Apple and Samsung have spent years trading blows at the top of the global smartphone market, often separated by slim margins and the timing of big launches. In 2025, though, Apple didnâ€™t just come out ahead â€” it managed to widen the gap. According to figures from Counterpoint Research , global smartphone shipments grew 2% year-on-year in 2025, marking the second straight year of growth. Apple finished the year with a 20% share of global shipments and 10% YoY growth, while Samsung followed with a 19% share and 5% growth. The result was a clearer lead for Apple than in 2024.

It almost goes without saying that you shouldnâ€™t let strangers use your phone for any claimed reason. All smartphones have an IMEI number , which is effectively the phoneâ€™s ID number. Unfortunately, cybercriminals and other bad actors often steal IMEI numbers to facilitate crimes. Now, a Redditor has outlined a rather crazy IMEI scam. Redditor Prudent-Vacation-581 reported that a person with Meta Ray-Ban smart glasses recently asked to make a call from their phone. The Redditor reported that the stranger instead dialed *#06#, which reveals the deviceâ€™s IMEI number, gave the phone back, and â€œran away.â€ The user received a pop-up on their phone the following day, noting that the device is now unlocked.

items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Googleâ€™s new universal checkout protocol aims to complete the purchase for you directly within a Gemini chat or AI search interface. Google built the Universal Commerce Protocol with input from major players like Shopify, Walmart, Target, Etsy, and Wayfair, with more than 20 partners already signed on. The new â€œBusiness Agentsâ€ also let brands answer shopper questions in conversational results using their own product knowledge. Imagine asking your phone for new running shoes, and instead of just getting links, an AI finds and buys them for you, so you donâ€™t have to switch between tabs. That future is now much closer. Google has unveiled a new open-standard framework that aims to make autonomous, AI-led shopping a real part of how we buy things online. At the center of this change is a protocol called Universal Commerce Protocol (UCP). It serves as a common language, enabling AI agents to connect with retailers, payment systems, and shopping platforms without requiring custom connections.

items.summary: Don't hold your breath for the OnePlus Open 2.
items.body: Credit: Ryan Haines / Android Authority TL;DR A noted leaker has claimed that the OnePlus Open 2 foldable phone has been canceled. This phone wouldâ€™ve been the long-awaited sequel to 2023â€™s OnePlus Open. Thereâ€™s also a â€œ90% chanceâ€ that the OnePlus 15s will be canceled. The OnePlus Open is the brandâ€™s first and only foldable phone to date, but itâ€™s been more than two years since its release. Weâ€™ve been hoping for a OnePlus Open 2, but it looks like OnePlus has other ideas. Leaker Yogesh Brar claimed on Twitter that OnePlus has canceled the OnePlus Open 2. This would be disappointing news if confirmed, and means global users would be deprived of what could be a high-quality foldable.

items.title: Cardiff fans warn WRU against Ospreys takeover deal

items.title: The Galaxy S26 series might finally make 24MP photos worth using
items.summary: A new leak suggests the Galaxy S26's rumored 24MP shooting mode could be in the Goldilocks zone for image quality.
items.body: Credit: Hadlee Simons / Android Authority TL;DR A leaker has revealed more details about the Galaxy S26â€™s new 24MP shooting mode. The mode will apparently avoid image quality issues seen in the Expert RAW appâ€™s 24MP mode. Itâ€™s believed 24MP shots will take roughly three seconds to process, but offer noticeably better image quality than 12MP snaps. Weâ€™ve heard for months now that the Samsung Galaxy S26 series could get a 24MP shooting mode via the Camera Assistant app. Now, a trusted tipster has revealed more details about this capability. Twitter tipster Ice Universe posted more apparent information about this shooting mode, corroborating reports that it needs to be enabled in the Camera Assistant app first. Once youâ€™ve turned on this feature, itâ€™ll be available as an option in the Galaxy S26â€™s default camera app.

items.title: Galaxy S25 series is doing something Samsung phones almost never do
items.summary: Something weird, and kind of impressive, is happening with the Galaxy S25 series.
items.body: TL;DR The Galaxy S25 reportedly experienced a rare sales bump eight to nine months after its launch. Tipster Ice Universe shared a chart showing how this breaks the typical sales pattern seen across multiple Galaxy S generations. Something unique seems to be happening with the Galaxy S25 series , and it defies trends from the past five generations of Galaxy S series flagships . According to tipster Ice Universe, the S25 lineup has broken a sales pattern that has held steady since the Galaxy S10 series. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: 49ers upset champions Eagles in play-offs to progress with Bills & Patriots
items.summary: The San Francisco 49ers come from behind twice in the final quarter to knock out defending champions Philadelphia as a thrilling NFL play-off series continues.

items.title: Your Galaxy phone is about to get very strange
items.summary: The unexpected surprise is pulled directly from another dimension.
items.body: Credit: C. Scott Brown / Android Authority TL;DR Samsung has released free Stranger Things themes and wallpapers for Galaxy phones. You can download them from the Galaxy Store if you have the Netflix app installed. The pack is only available from January 12 to February 22, so donâ€™t wait too long. Stranger Things may be over for good, but thatâ€™s not stopping Samsung from leaning hard into hype. To celebrate the final season of the mega-hit series, the company is now rolling out special Stranger Things theme packs and wallpapers for Galaxy phones. These new theme packs will be available for a limited time and will allow fans of the Netflix show to turn their homescreens into a scene from Hawkins or the Upside Down.

items.title: Got a random Instagram password reset email? Hereâ€™s what actually happened
items.summary: Instagram says there was no hack, but confirms something fishy took place.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR A wave of password reset emails went out to Instagram users around the world over the weekend. Instagram claims there was no data breach, but rather an abuse of its reset system. Even Android Authority got multiple reset emails for our official account. Over the weekend, Instagram users around the world were spooked after receiving unexpected emails asking them to reset their passwords. Given the nature of the email, many worried their accounts had been hacked.

items.title: Owning your music is now the only defense against AI infested playlists
items.summary: As streaming embraces AI music, the best way to escape is a return to ownership.
items.body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority Iâ€™m old enough to remember a time before Spotify heralded the golden age of music discovery. Even the early beta catalog gave me access to far more music than I could ever hope to fit on my iPod Nano, and, more importantly, made discovering new artists and exploring new genres unbelievably easy. Many of us probably owe a huge debt to streaming platforms for shaping our musical tastes and expanding our libraries. While the music streaming space has grown with both bigger libraries and a variety of new players, many of todayâ€™s top streaming platforms are quickly morphing into the very antithesis of the formula that made them such a game-changer. Unsurprisingly, itâ€™s driven by that most modern of problems: AI slop.

items.title: 'What a catch!' - Rams avoid play-off upset with 38 seconds remaining
items.summary: Colby Parkinson scores a touchdown with 38 seconds remaining as the Los Angeles Rams leave it late to beat the Carolina Panthers 34-31 to avoid a play-off upset.

items.title: Hereâ€™s the one thing I want to see from Pixel 11 Pro cameras
items.summary: Plenty of smartphone brands have picked up this camera trick, and I hope Google follows suit.
items.body: Googleâ€™s Pixel 10 phones are among the best camera phones on the market, and this generation marks the first time in a while that the entire series offers a telephoto camera. The Pixel 10 ships with a 10.8MP 5x camera, while the Pixel 10 Pro phones pack a great 50MP 5x periscope camera. Thereâ€™s one big feature missing from Googleâ€™s telephoto cameras, though, and I really hope to see it on the Pixel 11 Pro line. Of course, Iâ€™m talking about telephoto macro capabilities.

items.title: CES 2026: Aiper brings smarter, more reliable automation to the smart yard
items.summary: At CES 2026, Aiper showcased the first-ever Cognitive AI Powered pool cleaner series and smart irrigation system.
items.body: Having a backyard pool is an incredible luxury, but the maintenance of it might make it feel more like work than pleasure. Stopping algae blooms, avoiding grime buildup, and the endless leaf and branch skimming are grueling pool maintenance tasks. A smart robot pool cleaner can make a world of difference, and thatâ€™s where Aiper comes in. Aiper is the worldâ€™s no. 1 smart robotic pool cleaner brand known for its innovations in energy efficiency, sustainable design, and AI-driven automation. At CES 2026 , the company is showcasing the first-ever Cognitive AI Powered pool cleaners, the Scuba V3 series, along with its latest innovations in smart irrigation and pool water-quality management tools. With Aiper, youâ€™ll enjoy smart, reliable, and carefree smart yard maintenance, so you can spend more time in your yard rather than cleaning it. Hereâ€™s what you need to know.

items.title: Google Mapsâ€™ audio navigation quirks make it difficult to trust
items.summary: I can't keep an eye on my screen, but audio directions have left me with a bad taste.
items.body: While I use Google Maps even when Iâ€™m not navigating , I drove around a bit more during the holiday season and had to rely on the appâ€™s directions to get around. However, this made me acutely aware of its shortcomings when it comes to audio navigation â€” something I thought that Google wouldâ€™ve improved by now. When I drive, I mostly rely on Mapsâ€™ audio navigation. This is down to a few reasons: I donâ€™t have a smartphone mount that can reliably attach to my carâ€™s vents, I have no built-in dashboard display, and I have to stow my phone away when driving through high-crime areas.

items.title: 6 things you should always do before factory resetting a phone
items.summary: These precautions can save you from future headaches.
items.body: I thought that I had my phone factory reset process down to an art, thanks to the frequency with which I reset and send back review devices. But recently I had to reset an older device â€” and just before I was about to start the process, I decided to go back and check if it had missed anything important. Thatâ€™s when I realized it had a few things I actually hadnâ€™t backed up. After all, the data on a temporary or secondary device is generally less important than the data on one that you used as a daily driver. In my case, I was also selling the device, so I didnâ€™t have the option to simply leave it as-is in case I needed to recover something later.

items.title: I never expected an AI app to replace my keyboard, but I was wrong
items.summary: I've now started talking so much to my Mac.
items.body: I havenâ€™t typed a single word in this story â€” all of it came to life through my voice. I simply spoke to my computer what I wanted written, and the words appeared on the screen with punctuation corrected and my verbal fallacies ignored, without me lifting a finger. As a writer-journalist, I take pride in my ability to pound the keys fast enough to blur the motion without even once peeking at the keyboard. But there often comes a point when my fingers canâ€™t keep up with the pace of my rushing thoughts. And when your profession routinely demands meeting tight deadlines, speed becomes the most important factor . And somewhere along the way, typing itself became a holdback.

items.title: I (finally) ditched Google Photos for self-hosted; hereâ€™s how it went
items.summary: So long Google Photos, it's been great.
items.body: Credit: Robert Triggs / Android Authority I love Google Photos; its ease of use and feature set are unrivaled in my opinion. However, Iâ€™m an even bigger fan of self-hosting â€” I use my DIY NAS to replace a considerable range of overpriced subscription services. However, so far, I havenâ€™t been able to replace Google Photos completely, but I might have finally found a way to truly cut the cord. See, Iâ€™m loath to fork out for Google One when I have 10TB of hard drive space on my NAS. Still, I use Google Photos to make the occasional quick edit, to help share snaps with friends and family quickly, and even duplicate a few of my most cherished memories as part of the recommended 3-2-1 backup rule . For storing most of my older snaps, Iâ€™ve been using PhotoPrism, but as good as it is as a photo library, it lacks the rich feature set of Photos, especially for managing multiple users in my home.

items.title: As an Android fan, thereâ€™s only one iOS feature I want Google to copy
items.summary: Appleâ€™s seamless iPhone-to-iPhone migration is the gold standard that Google still hasnâ€™t matched for Android in 2026.
items.body: Android has long reached a point of maturity where it does a whole lot of things right for most of its user base. However, thereâ€™s always room for improvement, and one area that still frustrates me as an Android user is the process of migrating to a new phone. After using the past few generations of iPhones, Iâ€™ve noticed how excellently seamless and straightforward Appleâ€™s iPhone migration process is, and itâ€™s one of the first things I miss when I switch back to Android flagships. Google, itâ€™s 2026, and itâ€™s high time you copied Appleâ€™s simplicity in migration. Apple gets iPhone-to-iPhone transfers just right

items.title: I found the cutest (and strangest) Android phone at CES 2026
items.summary: It's two phones in one, or something like that.
items.body: I know that the Clicks Communicator got a lot of love at CES this year. Honestly, it probably deserves most of it â€” a physical keyboard with a fingerprint reader hidden in the spacebar is a cool design. It wasnâ€™t much of a surprise, though, as weâ€™d heard rumblings about big things out of Clicks leading up to the show. However, as I wandered the show floor on my last day in Las Vegas, I stumbled upon another tiny little Android device, and I think it might have stolen some of the Communicatorâ€™s thunder. Itâ€™s called the Ikko MindOne, and itâ€™s exactly the type of quirky little device I love to find at CES .

items.title: The Pixel 11 canâ€™t afford to get these 7 things wrong
items.summary: What Google must fix in 2026 if the Pixel 11 wants to stay relevant.
items.body: Pixels have always put the â€œsmartâ€ in the word smartphone. Theyâ€™ve stood for the best of the smart features and AI capabilities the smartphone world has ever seen, and have often led from the front. Compared to the AI features Pixels have been offering for years, like Magic Eraser, Apple Intelligence barely holds ground. I was mighty impressed by the Pixel 10 that launched last year, and I genuinely think itâ€™s a better phone than even the Pro model. Yet, I still feel the Pixel 10 series just wasnâ€™t enough. Thereâ€™s only so much Google can do to improve the Pixel 10 series through software updates â€” and to be fair, it does quite a lot. But as we enter 2026, my hopes are firmly placed on the Pixel 11. We still have a few months before the next Pixel launches, but I want to use this time to share my wishlist with Google.

items.title: New year, new me: 5 popular apps Iâ€™m replacing in 2026, and why
items.summary: The time has come.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority I always see the start of every year as a blank piece of paper â€” a chance to start fresh. And thatâ€™s exactly what Iâ€™ll be doing this year when it comes to the apps and services I use. I regularly use several of them, but itâ€™s time to make changes for two reasons. The first is that some of these apps simply donâ€™t serve me anymore, whether due to a lack of functionality or a price point thatâ€™s become too high. The second is that switching to a new app Iâ€™ll use regularly is actually a fun process for me. It gives me that boost of energy I need to kick off the year on the right note.

items.title: The tipping point: Hereâ€™s when buying a NAS make financial sense
items.summary: If youâ€™re paying for high tier cloud storage, the math may already favor owning a NAS.
items.body: With everything moving to a subscription model and increasing cloud dependence, we are living in the era of the forever tax. Between Spotify, Netflix, and cloud storage, we pay for music, movies, and to keep our own digital memories safe. And while cloud storage started as a convenient utility with fairly minimal charges for an additional 100GB of storage when photos were all we uploaded, thatâ€™s not the case anymore. Between years of data archives, larger photo files, and even larger 4K video-first content capture being the norm, for many of us, it has morphed into a significant monthly bill that we arenâ€™t really in a position to cancel. Over here at Android Authority , weâ€™ve talked about Network Attached Storage, or NAS , as a solution for the privacy-conscious or the tech-savvy enthusiasts who want to de-Google their lives and reduce their cloud dependence. Weâ€™ve even talked about data sovereignty and actually owning your files in a world that desperately wants you to rent them. But while all that is great, cost is another significant factor to consider. The fact of the matter is that a significant chunk of users considering a local storage option are only trying to reduce theirâ€¦

items.title: Wrexham's story 'written in the stars, literally'
items.summary: Wrexham's remarkable rise continues as they knock Premier League side Nottingham Forest out of the FA Cup in dramatic fashion.

items.title: An Android Auto bug is messing up messaging for some users
items.summary: Workspace account users are apparently being told to ask their admins for permission to reply to texts.
items.body: TL;DR Some Android Auto users are reporting seeing an error message when attempting to reply to messages. The problem seems isolated to users on Google Workspace accounts. An update to Android Auto is expected to roll out soon, but itâ€™s not obvious that update will solve this problem. Android Auto seems to be acting up for some users. 9to5Google spotted today that multiple users have reported theyâ€™re unable to reply to messages from their in-car displays, but the issue seems to be contained to a relatively small group of users. Apparently a recent bug is causing in-car Android Auto displays to throw up an error message when some users attempt to reply to messages, telling them that they need to ask their Google Workspace administrator for permission.

items.title: YouTube uploads stuck in processing? A fix is in the works

items.title: T-Mobile takes the crown for best overall experience in latest Opensignal tests

items.title: Nothing is finally ditching Lock Glimpse, but one model has to wait

items.body: TL;DR The December Nothing OS update removes Lock Glimpse from Nothing Phone 3a and 3a Pro. Nothing Phone 3a Lite still has Lock Glimpse installed, but it can be disabled. Nothing says a future update will let Phone 3a Lite users uninstall Lock Glimpse. Nothing phones started getting Android 16 with the rollout of Nothing OS 4.0 in November . On Nothing Phone 3a, 3a Pro , and 3a Lite, the update included a feature called Lock Glimpse, a widely panned addition that served ads on those phonesâ€™ lock screens. Now, Nothing has announced that itâ€™s bowing to user pressure and removing the feature â€” at least on the 3a and 3a Pro. Lock Glimpse has always been an optional feature, technically â€” 3a series phones on Nothing OS 4.0 present the option to disable it. That solution wasnâ€™t satisfactory, though, as users found the software was draining their batteries even when turned off . Today, Nothing shared that the feature is being removed from the 3a series (except the 3a Lite) as of the Nothing OS 4.0 December update.

items.title: Honorâ€™s slim Magic 8 Pro variant officially has a launch date, and itâ€™s soon

items.title: Ray-Ban Meta smart glasses can now single out a voice in a nosy crowd

Conversation focus is meant to amplify the voice of the person youâ€™re talking to to make conversation easier in noisy environments. The feature is available to try on Ray-Ban Meta and Oakley Meta HSTN glasses. Most smart glasses arenâ€™t explicitly made to be accessibility tools, but itâ€™s easy to imagine ways they could be used to that end. Take Metaâ€™s conversation focus, which uses smart glassesâ€™ built-in speakers to amplify the voice of the person youâ€™re talking to in noisy environments. The feature was announced months ago, but now, itâ€™s rolling out in a limited test. Meta announced its conversation focus feature at the companyâ€™s Connect event in September, and users have been able to sign up for a waitlist to try it since December. UploadVR spotted today that the feature is actually making its way to users whoâ€™ve signed up for Metaâ€™s Early Access program.

Thatâ€™s right, you wouldnâ€™t need to first turn the screen on or tap it to make the fingerprint scannerâ€™s active area visible. And it works even when you have the always-on display (AoD) turned off.

items.title: I tried the AI camera that watches you while you eat, and itâ€™s as weird as it sounds
items.summary: Between this and smart fitness glasses, Amazfit came prepared to CES 2026.
items.body: One of my favorite things about CES is the opportunity to see wild concept devices. Not all of these are home runs (such as Razerâ€™s AI anime girlfriend speaker ), but theyâ€™re still fascinating glimpses into what some companies see as the future of consumer tech. Health/fitness brand Amazfit has two such concept devices at CES 2026 â€” the V1TAL Food Camera and Helio Smart Glasses â€” and I had the opportunity to try both. The V1TAL is easily the most polarizing of the two, so letâ€™s start there. I saw the V1TAL behind closed doors at last yearâ€™s CES, but this was the first time I could photograph it and see it more thoroughly. As for what it is, itâ€™s exactly as I describe in the headline: an AI camera that watches you while you eat.

items.body: Iâ€™ve been reviewing Motorola devices for a long time â€” practically since I started here at Android Authority . In that time, Iâ€™ve seen significant growth and improvement, from reintroducing the Razr series (twice) to leveling up the Moto G family. And, while Iâ€™ve found a lot to praise in that time, Iâ€™ve never shied away from a few of Motorolaâ€™s more persistent issues. If youâ€™ve read any of my recent reviews, youâ€™ll know whatâ€™s coming, but hereâ€™s what Motorola needs to improve as we head into a new year.

items.title: This is our first look at how Samsung will save Bixby

Samsungâ€™s Bixby has spent the better part of the decade being the assistant we love to disable, but the new One UI 8.5 update could make that decision harder. Rather than competing directly with Google Gemini, Samsung is reportedly following Appleâ€™s lead by bringing in stronger AI support . Leaker @GalaxyTechie shared plenty of screenshots on X showing an early version of One UI 8.5 (via SamMobile ). In these images, Bixby sends complex questions to Perplexity instead of using its own limited knowledge. The responses look more like well-researched answers, complete with citations.

items.title: Fans blow. Could tiny speakers be a smarter way to cool down devices?
items.summary: An ultrasonic "fan on a chip" could be the next big breakthrough in mobile cooling.
items.body: TL;DR xMEMS is showing off its ÂµCooling system that uses ultrasonic speakers to move air. The system is silent, water-resistant, and can small enough to be used in wearables. A ducted ÂµCooling solution for phones could move up to 0.1 cubic feet of air a minute. Heat is arguably the biggest enemy of modern processors. We can build incredibly fast chips, but run them too fast, and theyâ€™re going to start to melt down. As a result, nearly every device we use has to make some sort of balance between performance and thermal emissions. This year at CES in Las Vegas , weâ€™re learning about an innovative new way that xMEMS is trying to tackle that problem, giving even compact mobile devices another option for staying cool. Itâ€™s expected to launch in 2026 and will adopt a wider aspect ratio than most book-style foldables, so the iPhone unfolds into a layout somewhat similar to that of an iPad Mini. And one of its priorities is likely to build a folding inner screen without a visible crease. In the pursuit of building the perfect, crease-free iPhone Fold, Apple is supposedly tinkering with existing foldables from other brands. Based on a rumor shared by a Weibo account with the username â€œFixed-focus digital cameras ,â€ Apple tore apart an OPPO Find N5 while trying to decode what enables the screenâ€™s crease to be so minimal.

items.summary: After a comfortable 4-1 series win in the Ashes, Australia's next goal will be winning in England for the first time in 26 years when they tour next summer, says Glenn McGrath.

items.title: Hereâ€™s how youâ€™ll finally be able to set up your own Calling Card on Android
items.summary: Google is solving the biggest Calling Card complaint on Android.
items.body: TL;DR Weâ€™ve managed to enable the upcoming â€œMy Calling Cardâ€ feature in Googleâ€™s Phone app. You can now create your own Calling Card, choose a photo, customize fonts, and control who sees it. If someone hasnâ€™t customized your card already, theyâ€™ll see your version when you call. Google introduced Calling Cards for Android last year. Just like iOS, Calling Card on Android lets you customize how incoming calls from friends and family appear on your phone. Itâ€™s a great feature, but has been lacking something big Apple offers with Contact Posters on iPhones since the feature came around. While you can customize how other peopleâ€™s Calling Cards look on your device, you canâ€™t control how your own Calling Card appears when calling other people. In October, we reported that Google is about to fix this limitation. We found that Google is working on a new â€œMy calling cardâ€ option inside the Phone by Google app to allow you to set up your own Calling Card that would appear for other users when you call them. At the time, the setting existed, but it didnâ€™t actually do anything. Now, we can show you exactly how youâ€™ll be able to set up your own calling card.

items.title: Your Kindle is losing this feature thanks to Microsoft

items.title: Watchdog sides with AT&T in false advertising dispute with T-Mobile

items.title: The technology that finally gave robot lawn mowers their autonomy
items.summary: When a robot mower understands the lawn, everything else gets easier.
items.body: The promise of a robotic lawn mower has always been an appealing one. Set it loose in the garden to get on with the job, and reclaim a chunk of your weekend in the process. That idea has been around for years on paper, but the reality is that it has taken much longer for robot mowers to live up to that hands-off ideal. The problem hasnâ€™t been power or even cutting ability. Modern robotic mowers are more than capable of trimming grass cleanly and consistently. Where things have historically fallen apart is navigation. A mower that canâ€™t reliably understand where it is or where to go will always need more babysitting than most people expect from an â€œautonomousâ€ machine.

With Android 16 QPR2 , which rolled out last month, Google introduced alerts every time your phone automatically switches to a new timezone . However, the feature doesnâ€™t tell you exactly how many hours or minutes your clocks shifted, which can make you take an extra step to look it up on Google if youâ€™re unaware of the exact time difference or want to figure out the time where your journey originated. But Google now appears to have reconsidered and might soon fill that vacuum. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. New code strings suggest that locked app notifications will show generic â€œNew messageâ€ or â€œNew notificationâ€ text instead of the usual notification content. Itâ€™s unclear whether the app name and icon in the notification will also be hidden. Weâ€™re slowly and steadily marching towards the release of Android 17 , which could come with new features such as a long-awaited native App Lock solution. We already have a decent idea of how this rumored feature would work, but there were a few unknowns, one of which was how the feature would handle incoming notifications from locked apps. Thanks to the Android Canary 2601 release , we have an answer. NEWSLETTER | Authority Insights --> Authority Insights You're reading an Authority Insights story. Subscribe to our new Authority Insights newsletter for more exclusive reports, app teardowns, leaks, and in-depth tech coverage you won't find anywhere else. sign up now By signing up, you agree to our Terms of Use and acknowledge the data practices in our Privacy Policy. You may unsubscribe at any time. Within this new Android Canary build, â€¦

items.title: Google drops the paywall on Gmailâ€™s most useful new tools
items.summary: Gmail's Help Me Write, AI summaries, and smart replies are coming to everyone for free.
items.body: Credit: Joe Maring / Android Authority TL;DR Google is removing the paywall from its top-tier Gmail AI tools, previously locked behind subscriptions like Google AI Plus and Ultra. Features such as Help Me Write, Suggested Replies, and AI Overviews are now rolling out to everyone for free. If you thought the best Gmail tricks were only for paying subscribers, youâ€™re not alone. For quite some time, Gmailâ€™s most helpful new AI features have only been available to premium users. Thatâ€™s changing now. Google is removing the paywall and giving three of its most useful tools to every Gmail user for free. Before this change, getting all the AI features in Gmail meant subscribing to high-tier plans like Google AI Plus, Google AI Ultra, Google AI Pro, or other Premium tiers. Now, that barrier is gone. Regular Gmail users will soon get a big upgrade in how they manage daily emails without spending a dime.

items.title: Gmail now answers your email questions like Google Search â€” but youâ€™ll have to pay for it
items.summary: You can now ask questions in natural language, and Gmail will give you a summarized answer from your emails.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Gmail users can now use natural language questions to find specific information buried in their emails, presented to them as an AI Overview. The new Proofread feature in Gmail enables users to refine their grammar, tone, conciseness, and style using AI. Both features are powered by Gemini and are available exclusively to paid Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers in English, with a web-first rollout in the US. Most of us use Gmail practically every day, and any improvements Google can make to make emails a little easier to handle would be appreciated by billions of people worldwide (three billion, to be precise). The company announced that some of Gmailâ€™s most helpful new AI features are now being made available to all users for free . Thereâ€™s still a reason to pay for Gmail, though, as Google is now introducing new features for Google AI Pro and Ultra subscribers. Donâ€™t want to miss the best from Android Authority ?

items.title: Gmail will soon help you make sense of your messy inbox, Inbox-style
items.summary: It's like getting a lowdown from an assistant who reads your emails for you.
items.body: Credit: Edgar Cervantes / Android Authority TL;DR Google has announced a new AI Inbox feature that will organize important emails from your Gmail inbox into handy to-do lists. AI Inbox will prioritize emails from VIPs, such as those you email frequently or people in your Contacts. In addition to heads-up for important events, the feature will also offer summaries based on different conversations about a related topic. For more than a decade, Gmail has automatically sorted your emails in different categories, using labels such as Primary, Social, Promotions, etc. The method has been effective, but given the bloated influx of emails, both spammy and useful, Google has determined it needs to step up. This is why it is piloting a new mechanism that not only sorts and prioritizes your important emails but also provides a summary of whatâ€™s important, so you stay on top. And as youâ€™d expect, it is powered by Gemini . Google is calling this new Gmail experience â€œAI Inbox,â€ perhaps because it is built on the same productivity-focused ethos as the now-entombed Google Inbox . It says AI Inbox is identical to being briefed by a personal assistant for your most important commitments and gettinâ€¦

items.title: The man behind the headlines - Salah, by Klopp, Diaz and more
items.summary: BBC Sport explores Mohamed Salah's personality with help from the people who know him best.

items.title: Inside McLaren's season - the rules, values, incidents & relationships
items.summary: Intra-team title battles turn toxic far more often than not. Andrew Benson analyses how McLaren have maintained relative harmony between Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri.

items.title: England's AI World Cup masterplan - from perfecting penalties to powering players
items.summary: BBC Sport hears from inside the England setup about how artificial intelligence is powering plans for next summer's World Cup.

items.title: 'Raise hell' - the fastest bowler you might not have heard of
items.summary: The story of Duncan Spencer, the "frighteningly fast" bowler who could have played for England or Australia.
